meanings.sent1: He clonked the hammer on the table to fix it.
meanings.sent2: She accidentally clonked her head on the low doorway.
meanings.sent3: The clown clonked the drum so hard that it made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The boxer's punch clonked his opponent right on the chin.
meanings.sent5: The tree branch clonked loudly as it fell to the ground.

meanings.definition: A dull, heavy sound made by a blow or collision.
meanings.sent1: The clonked of the car crash echoed through the street.
meanings.sent2: The clonked of the hammer hitting the metal was deafening.
meanings.sent3: The clonked of the falling book startled the cat.
meanings.sent4: The clonked of the falling tree branch could be heard from afar.
meanings.sent5: The clonked of the two rocks hitting each other was like thunder in the cave.
